Title: The Book of Mazarbul
Text: I should search the Tomb area for some clues on what happened here.

pages:
We drove out orcs from the Great Gate and guard room and took the First Hall. 
We slew many in the bright sun in the Dale.
Flói was killed by an arrow.
He slayed the great Chieftain.

We did burry Flói under grass near Mirrormere, but more came.
We have taken the twenty-first hall of the northern end to dwell in. There is good air.
It can be easily watched over and the shaft is clear.

Balin has set up his seat in the Chamber of Mazarbul. We gathered lots of gold and we found Durin's Axe
and his silver helmet.
Balin has taken them for his own.
He is now the lord of Moria.

Today we found truesilver, wellforged helmet and a coat made all of purest mithril. 
We sent Óin to seek for the upper armories of the third deep and then go Westwards to seek up to Hollin gate

5 years have past since we settled in Moria and sorrow
has already fallen on us.
Yesterday being the tenth of November.
Balin lord of Moria fell in Dimrill Dale, he went alone to look in Mirrormere.
An orc shot him from behind a stone.

We slew the orc, but many more came up from east from the Silverlode.
We rescued Balin's body.
There was an intense battle.
We have barred the gates, but we doubt it can hold them for long.

If there is no escape, we will suffer a horrible fate-but 
I SHALL HOLD.

We cannot get out. 
They have taken the bridge and the second hall. Frár & Lóni & Náli fell bravely, while the rest retreated to Mazarbul. We are still holding them off, but hope is dying.
Óin's party went 5 days ago,

but today only 4 returned.
The pool is up to the wall at Westgate, the Watcher in the Water took Óin.
We cannot get out.
We hear drums from within the deep.
The end is coming.
